name: Srilatha Nenavath
title: Senior QA Engineer
professional_summary: I am having 9 years of experience in quality assurance testing across Healthcare, Insurance, E-commerce, Government, and Telecommunications domains with specialized focus on test planning and execution in Agile environments.
Created comprehensive test strategies for mainframe systems including COBOL, JCL, and DB2 applications while ensuring compliance with HIPAA regulations in healthcare environments at Aetna.
Developed automated test frameworks using Selenium WebDriver and REST Assured to validate API endpoints in insurance systems, improving defect detection rates by around 60% at Prudential Financial.
Conducted functional, integration, regression, and performance testing for e-commerce platforms at Target, utilizing JMeter and LoadRunner to simulate high-traffic scenarios during holiday seasons.
Managed defect lifecycle using Jira and qTest for government child support systems at State of Utah, documenting all test results and collaborating with cross-functional teams to resolve issues.
Implemented data validation processes across mainframe and interface systems in telecommunications projects at Sutherland, using SQL queries to verify data integrity between databases.
Built custom Python scripts to automate test data generation for insurance claim processing systems, reducing manual preparation time by approximately 40% and increasing test coverage.
Worked closely with development teams to integrate API testing tools like Postman and SoapUI into CI/CD pipelines, enabling continuous testing of microservices architecture in cloud environments.
Executed UAT support activities for healthcare insurance portals, creating detailed documentation and walkthrough guides for business stakeholders to validate system functionality.
Applied SDLC and testing methodologies to ensure quality standards were met throughout the software development lifecycle, participating in sprint planning and retrospective meetings.
Designed test scenarios for Salesforce applications in insurance domain, using Selenium and Provar to automate user interface testing and validate business workflows.
Analyzed batch job results using JCL monitoring utilities, creating automated reports to track execution status and identify performance bottlenecks in mainframe processing systems.
Collaborated with Test supervisors and project managers to prioritize testing efforts based on risk assessment and business impact, ensuring critical functionalities were thoroughly validated.
Resolved complex technical issues by investigating system logs and database records, applying problem-solving skills to identify root causes of defects in multi-tier applications.
Integrated security testing practices into regular testing cycles, validating authentication mechanisms and data encryption methods to protect sensitive healthcare information.
Adapted to changing requirements in Agile environments by modifying test plans and cases on the fly, maintaining clear communication with product owners about potential impacts.
Supported performance testing initiatives by designing realistic test scenarios based on production usage patterns, helping teams identify scalability issues before deployment.
Established best practices for test documentation and knowledge sharing, creating templates and guidelines that were adopted across multiple projects to improve consistency.

responsibilities: Developed comprehensive test strategies for healthcare insurance claims processing systems using Azure DevOps pipelines to ensure HIPAA compliance while maintaining high test coverage across web and mobile platforms.

Managed defect lifecycle using Azure DevOps work items, tracking issues from discovery to resolution while providing detailed reports to stakeholders about quality metrics and trends.

Facilitated UAT sessions with business stakeholders, creating detailed test scenarios that reflected real-world usage of the healthcare portal and gathering feedback for improvements.
